intro: Crotalaria leptoclona, commonly known as slender crownflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, and the plant is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Crotalaria leptoclona is also noted for its ornamental value and use in traditional medicine.
